title: Fragment With Partial Chef, ca. 1820
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: printed by roller and individual stamps on plain weave
markings: In one box "MANUFACTURE DE HARTMANN ET FILS ASSOCIES DE SOEHNEE ET Cie A MUNSTER HAUT RHIN" , in another box "RAS", in a circle " ST. D.s", un boxed "671", "337" and a cross shape all in black. The number 14 in red on the front.
description: End of a bolt containing part of a roller printed pattern in red  and the Manufacturer's identifying marks in black. The central scene shows a Roman being restrained and put into handcuffs. The design may be one of the versions of Belisarius.

tombstone.epitaph:
Fragment With Partial Chef, ca. 1820.
ca. 1820. Medium: cotton
Technique: printed by roller and individual stamps on plain weave. Bequest of Elinor Merrell. 1995-50-349.
